key_points: Facebook and its entities Instagram, WhatsApp, Messenger, and Oculus experienced a six-hour outage on Oct. 4.
The outage highlighted the risk of over-reliance on a single platform for communication and business operations.
Many brands and organizations use Facebook for advertising, retail outreach, virtual events, and customer service.
John Guilfoil advises against relying on a single platform and encourages diversifying communication methods.
Guilfoil noted that some entities, including town fire chiefs, prefer Facebook over creating and updating a website.
The outage resulted in communication disruptions for those solely relying on Facebook, including the disappearance of news archives.
Guilfoil promotes the use of simple, free tools to create websites and advocates a 'web first' approach.
During the outage, advised clients were able to maintain communication through other platforms like Twitter, LinkedIn, and email.
The incident serves as a reminder of the importance of having backup systems and contingency plans.
The importance of websites and diversified communication strategies is emphasized, even in the era of dominant social media platforms.
spokespersons: John Guilfoil (Principal, John Guilfoil Public Relations LLC)
